titles.ar: باب الدَّلَالَةِ فِي الْبَيْعِ وَ أَجْرِهَا وَ أَجْرِ السِّمْسَارِ
titles.en: Chapter 140 – The brokerage in the selling and its fee, and the fee of the realtor
Chapter 141 – Partnership with the Zimmy (non-Muslim taxpayer)

titles.ar: باب سُخْرَةِ الْعُلُوجِ وَ النُّزُولِ عَلَيْهِمْ
titles.en: Chapter 139 – Forced labour of the non-Muslims and the lodging upon them

titles.ar: باب الدَّلَالَةِ فِي الْبَيْعِ وَ أَجْرِهَا وَ أَجْرِ السِّمْسَارِ
titles.en: Chapter 140 – The brokerage in the selling and its fee, and the fee of the realtor

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (19/380)

parts.text: أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي الرَّجُلِ يَدُلُّ عَلَى الدُّورِ

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ بَشَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي الرَّجُلِ يَدُلُّ عَلَى الدُّورِ وَ الضِّيَاعِ وَ يَأْخُذُ عَلَيْهِ الْأَجْرَ قَالَ

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Husayn Bin Bashhar,

from Abu Al Hassan<sup>asws</sup> regarding the man who indicates upon the houses and the places, and he takes the (finder’s)  fee upon it. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘This is a renumeration. There is no problem with it’.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Al-Husayn ibn al-Bashshar who has said the following: “About the case of a broker who shows houses and assets for a certain amount of fee, abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, said it is not unlawful.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (19/381)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ أَوْ غَيْرِهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ قَالَ

text: سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) وَ أَنَا أَسْمَعُ فَقَالَ لَهُ إِنَّا نَأْمُرُ الرَّجُلَ فَيَشْتَرِي لَنَا الْأَرْضَ وَ الْغُلَامَ وَ الدَّارَ وَ الْخَادِمَ وَ نَجْعَلُ لَهُ جُعْلًا قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ بِذَلِكَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, or someone else, from Abdullah Bin Sinan who said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> was asked and I was listening, so he said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘We instruct the man, so he buys the land for us, and the slave, and the house, and the servant, and we make a fee to be for him’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem with that’.
en.sarwar: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from and others from ‘Abd Allah ibn Sinan who has said the following: “Once abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, was asked, when I was listening, ‘We order a man to buy land, slave, a house or a servant for us and assign a certain amount for him. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not unlawful.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (9/381)

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا مِنْ أَصْحَابِ الرَّقِيقِ قَالَ

text: اشْتَرَيْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) جَارِيَةً فَنَاوَلَنِي أَرْبَعَةَ دَنَانِيرَ فَأَبَيْتُ فَقَالَ لَتَأْخُذَنَّ فَأَخَذْتُهَا وَ قَالَ لَا تَأْخُذْ مِنَ الْبَائِعِ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from one of our companions, from the companions of Al Raqeq who said,

‘I bought a slave girl for Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, so he<sup>asws</sup> gave me four Dinars, but I refused (to accept it). So he<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘Take it!’ So I took it and he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Do not take from the seller’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ahmad ibn Muhammad has narrated from ibn abu ‘Umayr from certain persons of our people of slave traders who has said the following: “I once bought a slave-girl for abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, and he (the Imam) gave me four dinars but I declined. He (the Imam) said, ‘You must take it’ and I took it and he (the Imam) said, ‘You must not take anything from the seller.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (19/381)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ وَ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبِي سَأَلَ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) وَ أَنَا أَسْمَعُ فَقَالَ لَهُ رُبَّمَا أَمَرْنَا الرَّجُلَ فَيَشْتَرِي لَنَا الْأَرْضَ وَ الدَّارَ وَ الْغُلَامَ وَ الْجَارِيَةَ وَ نَجْعَلُ لَهُ جُعْلًا قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, and Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Mahboub, from Abdullah Bin Sinan who said,

‘I heard my father asking Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> and I was listening, so he said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘Sometimes we instruct the man so he buys for us the land, and the house, and the slave, and the slave girl, and we make a fee to be for him’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem’.
en.sarwar: 4. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad and Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Mahbub from ‘Abd Allah ibn Sinan who has said the following: “Once, a man asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, when I was listening, ‘We perhaps order a man to buy for us land, house, slave or slave-girl and assign for him a certain amount. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not unlawful.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (19/382)

narrator_chain.text: وَ عَنْهُمَا عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي وَلَّادٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) وَ غَيْرِهِ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالُوا قَالَ

text: ا لَا بَأْسَ بِأَجْرِ السِّمْسَارِ إِنَّمَا هُوَ يَشْتَرِي لِلنَّاسِ يَوْماً بَعْدَ يَوْمٍ بِشَيْ‏ءٍ مَعْلُومٍ وَ إِنَّمَا هُوَ مِثْلُ الْأَجِيرِ .

en.hubeali: And from the two of them, from Ibn Mahboub, from Abu Al Wallad,

from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> and someone else, from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> both having said: ‘There is no problem with fee if the broker. But rather, he buys for the people day after day, with something known, and rather it is like the employee’.
en.sarwar: 5. It is narrated from the two of them from ibn Mahbub from abu Wallad and others who has said the following: “They have said that abu Ja‘far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Payment for brokerage fee to a broker who buys goods for people day after day is not unlawful.’”
